chunks.cleaned_english_translation:
<speak>
    Letter of Aurelius to Pope Damasus
</speak>

To the most blessed Pope Damasus, Aurelius, Bishop of Carthage. We humbly seek the glory of the apostolic seat and the grace of your eminence. We kindly ask you to send us, in writing, any decrees you can find from the time of the blessed prince of the apostles, Peter, up to the beginning of your holiness, governed by the wisdom and authority of the apostolic seat. Through the nobility and wisdom of your holiness, we hope to learn what was decreed in the holy seat during those times, and to know who acted against the apostolic canons. Farewell, most holy Pope, and please pray for us, most loving father. Given on the eighth day before the Kalends of March. Read in Rome on the fifth day before the Nones of May.
chunks.original_latin:
Beatissimo papae DAMASO AURELIUS Carthaginensis
episcopus. Gloriam apostolicae sedis, et vestrae sublimitatis
gratiam nostra humilitas exoret , ut statuta,
quae reperire poteritis, post finem beati principis
apostolorum Petri, usque ad vestrae sanctitatis principium
juxta apostolicae sedis auctoritatem, quam cognovimus
per vestrae sapientiae sanctitatem gubernari,
 nobis scripta mittere dignemini: quatenus per
vestrae sanctitatis nobilitatem atque prudentiam
nosse valeamus, quae in praefecta sancta sede supra
dictis temporibus sunt decreta, et qui adversus canonum
apostolorum instituta gesserunt, cognoscantur. Bene vale, sanctissime papa, et ora pro nobis
amantissime pater. Data octavo kalendas Martii. Idem lecta Romae, quinto nonas Maii. <span class="text-blue-600 font-bold"
